case_vignette: A 14-year-old boy who has been otherwise healthy presents to his doctor complaining of feeling easily winded and light-headed at basketball practice. He has never felt this way before and is frustrated because he is good enough to make varsity this year. He denies smoking, alcohol, or recreational drug use. His mother is very worried because her oldest son and brother had both died suddenly while playing sports despite being otherwise healthy. The transthoracic echocardiogram confirms the suspected diagnosis, which demonstrates a preserved ejection fraction and systolic anterior motion of the mitral valve. The patient is advised that he will need to stay hydrated and avoid intense exercise, and he will likely need an ICD due to his family history.
question: Which  physical exam findings is consistent with this patient’s most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling easily winded and light-headed at basketball practice.
Have you had any chest pain or discomfort during these symptoms?
No, I haven't had any chest pain or discomfort.
Have you had any shortness of breath or difficulty breathing during these symptoms?
Yes, I've had shortness of breath when I feel winded.
Have you had any history of heart disease or high blood pressure?
No, I've been otherwise healthy.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
No, I haven't been taking any medications.
Have you had any family history of heart disease or other cardiovascular conditions?
Yes, my oldest brother and uncle both died suddenly while playing sports, even though they were healthy.
Final Diagnosis: Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA)

The symptoms are not accompanied by chest pain or discomfort, but there is shortness of breath when feeling winded. The student reports being otherwise healthy and not taking any medications. trial_0.vignette_frq: The patient's most likely diagnosis is hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). Physical exam findings consistent with this diagnosis include a loud S2 sound, a systolic murmur at the apex, and a palpable thrill.
